intro: Anisopus bicornatus, commonly known as the two-horned anisopus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or greenish flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anisopus bicornatus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
